Advancement of physical training of individual actors to their maximum potential. Experience in techniques and discovery of origins of variety of acrobatic and dance disciplines, including ballet, ballroom, period dance, and circus techniques. Letter grading.
THEATER 425F.title: Advanced Movement II

THEATER 425G.description: Studio, three to six hours. Advanced physical training for actors in one or more movement, dance, or combat discipline: capoeira, martial arts, ballet, ballroom, period dance, circus techniques. Letter grading.
THEATER 425G.title: Advanced Movement III

THEATER 425H.description: Studio, three to six hours. Advanced physical training for actors in one or more movement, dance, or combat discipline: capoeira, martial arts, ballet, ballroom, period dance, circus techniques. Letter grading.
THEATER 425H.title: Advanced Movement III

THEATER 425I.description: Studio, three to six hours. Advanced physical training for actors in one or more movement, dance, or combat discipline: capoeira, martial arts, ballet, ballroom, period dance, circus techniques. Letter grading.
THEATER 425I.title: Advanced Movement III

THEATER 426A.description: Studio, three to six hours. Study and practice in Alexander techniques as method of developing balance, poise, and coordination of body and mind. Exploration of use of rhythm to expand movement potential of actors and relevant use of visual arts and animal studies to character development and to expansion of movement potential. Letter grading.
THEATER 426A.title: Alexander Techniques

THEATER 426B.description: Studio, three to six hours. Study and practice in Alexander techniques as method of developing balance, poise, and coordination of body and mind. Exploration of use of rhythm to expand movement potential of actors and relevant use of visual arts and animal studies to character development and to expansion of movement potential. Letter grading.
THEATER 426B.title: Alexander Techniques

THEATER 426C.description: Studio, three to six hours. Study and practice in Alexander techniques as method of developing balance, poise, and coordination of body and mind. Exploration of use of rhythm to expand movement potential of actors and relevant use of visual arts and animal studies to character development and to expansion of movement potential. Letter grading.
THEATER 426C.title: Alexander Techniques

THEATER 429.description: Studio, four hours. Limited to graduate students not enrolled in M.F.A. acting program. Exercises in performance techniques, including autodrama and scene study. Development of performance skills through scene study, use of self, and personalization. Examination of characterization exercises and their application to scenes. Letter grading.
THEATER 429.title: Performance Workshop

THEATER 430A.description: Lecture, three hours. Limited to M.F.A. playwriting program students. Guided completion of full-length scripts for stage. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 430A.title: Advanced Studies in Playwriting

THEATER 430B.description: Lecture, three hours. Limited to M.F.A. playwriting program students. Guided completion of full-length scripts for stage. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 430B.title: Advanced Studies in Playwriting

THEATER 430C.description: Lecture, three hours. Limited to M.F.A. playwriting program students. Guided completion of full-length scripts for stage. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 430C.title: Advanced Studies in Playwriting

THEATER 431.description: Discussion, three hours. Designed for M.F.A. playwriting program students. Analysis and practice of varied aspects of playwright's art. Variable content selected from topics such as comedy writing, docudrama, writing for alternative audiences, adaptation from stage to screen, children's theater, or improvisational techniques. May be repeated twice for credit. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 431.title: Special Topics in Playwriting

THEATER 432.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 230A, 230B, 230C. Survey of contemporary adaptation for stage, with selected readings of playwriting adaptation techniques, and outline and development of adaptation for stage. Letter grading.
THEATER 432.title: Theatrical Adaptation

THEATER 433B.description: (Formerly numbered C433B.) Lecture, three hours; studio, four to 24 hours. Designed for graduate students. Guided process of script development, with emphasis on communication, artistic growth, and professional process. May be taken for maximum of 8 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 433B.title: Script Development Workshop

THEATER 435AF.description: Lecture, two hours. Limited to M.F.A. candidates. Review discussion and critique of playwriting projects. May be repeated for maximum of 6 units. In Progress grading (credit to be given only on completion of courses 435AW and 435AS).
THEATER 435AF.title: Problems in Advanced Writing for Stage

THEATER 435AS.description: Lecture, two hours. Limited to M.F.A. candidates. Review discussion and critique of playwriting projects. May be repeated for maximum of 6 units. S/U grading.
THEATER 435AS.title: Problems in Advanced Writing for Stage

THEATER 435AW.description: Lecture, two hours. Limited to M.F.A. candidates. Review discussion and critique of playwriting projects. May be repeated for maximum of 6 units. In Progress grading (credit to be given only on completion of course 435AS).
THEATER 435AW.title: Problems in Advanced Writing for Stage

THEATER 441A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study and practice in lighting actors, emphasizing textual and character analysis from lighting designer's perspective, conceptual development with director, effect of light on dynamics of staging, use of color in light, and relationship of lighting designer to actor. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 441A.title: Lighting Design

THEATER 441B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of use of light and color to define space, effect of light on scenery and costumes, lighting for arena/thrust theaters, multiscenic productions, lighting patterns, and moving scenery. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 441B.title: Lighting Design

THEATER 441C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Investigation of lighting design in production, musical theater, opera, touring, and repertory situations. Study of analysis of script and score for lighting designer. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 441C.title: Lighting Design

THEATER 441D.description: Lecture/laboratory, four hours. Designed for graduate students. Advanced study and practice in scenic projection and media techniques, with emphasis on analysis, design, and execution of theatrical projection and photographic technique for stage. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 441D.title: Scenic Projection and Media Techniques

THEATER 442A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Advanced study and practice in costume design for theater. Imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, period style, and character analysis leading to visual presentation of design. Study of costume design for theatrical productions, ballet, opera, and musical theater. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 442A.title: Costume Design

THEATER 442B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Advanced study and practice in costume design for theater. Imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, period style, and character analysis leading to visual presentation of design. Study of costume design for theatrical productions, ballet, opera, and musical theater. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 442B.title: Costume Design

THEATER 442C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Advanced study and practice in costume design for theater. Imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, period style, and character analysis leading to visual presentation of design. Study of costume design for theatrical productions, ballet, opera, and musical theater. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 442C.title: Costume Design

THEATER 443A.description: (Formerly numbered 443.) Studio, four hours. Advanced study and practice of scenic design for theater, with emphasis on cultivating imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, composition, and style leading to visual presentation of design, as well as exploration of students' individual cognitive and artistic process and refinement of techniques. May be repeated twice for credit. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 443A.title: Advanced Scenic Design

THEATER 443B.description: Studio, four hours. Advanced study and practice of scenic design for theater, with emphasis on cultivating imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, composition, and style leading to visual presentation of design, as well as exploration of students' individual cognitive and artistic process and refinement of techniques. May be repeated twice for credit. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 443B.title: Advanced Scenic Design

THEATER 443C.description: Studio, four hours. Advanced study and practice of scenic design for theater, with emphasis on cultivating imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, composition, and style leading to visual presentation of design, as well as exploration of students' individual cognitive and artistic process and refinement of techniques. May be repeated twice for credit. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 443C.title: Advanced Scenic Design

THEATER 443D.description: Studio, four hours. Advanced study and practice of scenic design for theater, with emphasis on cultivating imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, composition, and style leading to visual presentation of design, as well as exploration of students? individual cognitive and artistic process and refinement of techniques. May be repeated twice for credit. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 443D.title: Advanced Scenic Design

THEATER 445A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study and practice in design of scenic environment for film, video, and entertainment media, including effect of differing media on design choices, role of production designers and art directors, and design for single- and multiple-camera production. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 445A.title: Production Design for Film, Television, and Entertainment Media

THEATER 445B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study and practice in design of scenic environment for film, video, and entertainment media, including effect of differing media on design choices, role of production designers and art directors, and design for single- and multiple-camera production. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 445B.title: Production Design for Film, Television, and Entertainment Media

THEATER 445C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study and practice in design of scenic environment for film, video, and entertainment media, including effect of differing media on design choices, role of production designers and art directors, and design for single- and multiple-camera production. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 445C.title: Production Design for Film, Television, and Entertainment Media

THEATER 448A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study and practice in design of costumes for live and virtual characters in film, television, and entertainment media, including effect of differing media on design choices. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 448A.title: Costume Design for Film, Television, and Entertainment Media

THEATER 448B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study and practice in design of costumes for live and virtual characters in film, television, and entertainment media, including effect of differing media on design choices. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 448B.title: Costume Design for Film, Television, and Entertainment Media

THEATER 448C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study and practice in design of costumes for live and virtual characters in film, television, and entertainment media, including effect of differing media on design choices. May be repeated twice for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER 448C.title: Costume Design for Film, Television, and Entertainment Media

THEATER 448D.description: Lecture, three hours; screenings, two hours. Exploration of integration of costume design into filmmaking process and illumination of work required to bring characters from written page to life. Letter grading.
THEATER 448D.title: Deconstructing Glamour

THEATER 449.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Series of group design projects that serve as comprehensive examination for M.F.A. degree in entertainment design. Review and evaluation of projects by design faculty members from all areas of curriculum. Letter grading.
THEATER 449.title: Design Thesis Project

THEATER 457D.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Introduction to costume design as tool for interpretation of one renowned artwork and as intrinsic element of art history to gain expertise in costume and pattern making, while creating half-scale costume inspired by masterwork and to gain familiarity with artist's life and social milieu. Letter grading.
THEATER 457D.title: Advanced Historical Costume Interpretation and Construction (Effective Spring 2018 )

THEATER 459A.description: Lecture, three hours. Limited to graduate theater students. Analysis and exploration, with specific scenes, of differences and many similarities in directorial approach to same literary material in three media. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 459A.title: Directing for Theater, Film, and Television

THEATER 459B.description: Lecture, three hours. Limited to graduate theater students. Analysis and exploration, with specific scenes, of differences and many similarities in directorial approach to same literary material in three media. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 459B.title: Directing for Theater, Film, and Television

THEATER 460AF.description: Discussion, three hours. Designed for graduate students. Discussion of role of director in contemporary professional practice. Review discussion and critique of directing projects. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 460AF.title: Contemporary Issues in Direction

THEATER 460AS.description: Discussion, three hours. Designed for graduate students. Discussion of role of director in contemporary professional practice. Review discussion and critique of directing projects. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 460AS.title: Contemporary Issues in Direction

THEATER 460AW.description: Discussion, three hours. Designed for graduate students. Discussion of role of director in contemporary professional practice. Review discussion and critique of directing projects. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 460AW.title: Contemporary Issues in Direction

THEATER 462.description: Studio, 12 or 30 hours. Designed for graduate students. Advanced problems in directing for theater, film, and television. May be repeated for maximum of 24 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 462.title: Advanced Directing

THEATER 463.description: Studio, 24 hours. Designed for graduate students. Creative participation as director in conceptualization and preparation of dramatic work. Letter grading.
THEATER 463.title: Production Project in Direction for Stage

THEATER 472.description: Studio, three to eight hours. Exploration and laboratory experience in one or more various aspects of production and postproduction practice for entertainment media, including theater, film, video, and digital media. May be repeated for maximum of 24 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 472.title: Production Practice in Theater, Film, Video, and Digital Media

THEATER 474.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study and practice in preparation and execution of designs for theater, film, video, and related entertainment forms. As contributing artistic member of design team, creative responsibilities include designer, technical supervisor, or production manager. May be repeated for maximum of 16 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 474.title: Advanced Projects in Design and Production

THEATER 475A.description: Lecture, four hours; studio, four to eight hours. Preparation: at least six master scenic design courses. Preparation of complete designs and drawings for theatrical, film, operatic, and theoretical productions and assembling of design portfolio and résumé. Information about industry demands and protocol for portfolio presentation and review, with projects prepared under guidance of respective design faculty adviser. Letter grading.
THEATER 475A.title: Graduate Design Portfolio Project: Scenic Design

THEATER 475B.description: Lecture, four hours; studio, four to eight hours. Preparation: at least six master lighting design courses. Preparation of complete designs and drawings for theatrical, film, operatic, and theoretical productions and assembling of design portfolio and résumé. Information about industry demands and protocol for portfolio presentation and review, with projects prepared under guidance of respective design faculty adviser. Letter grading.
THEATER 475B.title: Graduate Design Portfolio Project: Lighting Design

THEATER 475C.description: Lecture, four hours; studio, four to eight hours. Preparation: at least six master costume design courses. Preparation of complete designs and drawings for theatrical, film, operatic, and theoretical productions and assembling of design portfolio and résumé. Information about industry demands and protocol for portfolio presentation and review, with projects prepared under guidance of respective design faculty adviser. Letter grading.
THEATER 475C.title: Graduate Design Portfolio Project: Costume Design

THEATER 495A.description: Seminar, to be arranged; discussion, two hours. Limited to Ph.D. students. Study and practice of teaching theater at university level. Orientation and preparation of graduate (Ph.D.) students who have responsibility to assist in teaching undergraduate courses in department. Discussion of problems common to teaching experience. Letter grading.
THEATER 495A.title: Practicum and Practice in Teaching Theater

THEATER 495B.description: Seminar, to be arranged; discussion, two hours. Limited to Ph.D. students. Study and practice of teaching theater at university level. Orientation and preparation of graduate (Ph.D.) students who have responsibility to assist in teaching undergraduate courses in department. Discussion of problems common to teaching experience. Letter grading.
THEATER 495B.title: Practicum and Practice in Teaching Theater

THEATER 495C.description: Seminar, to be arranged; discussion, two hours. Limited to Ph.D. students. Study and practice of teaching theater at university level. Orientation and preparation of graduate (Ph.D.) students who have responsibility to assist in teaching undergraduate courses in department. Discussion of problems common to teaching experience. Letter grading.
THEATER 495C.title: Practicum and Practice in Teaching Theater

THEATER 498.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Full- or part-time at studio or on professional project. Designed for advanced M.F.A. students. Internship at various film, television, or theater facilities accentuating creative contribution, organization, and work of professionals in their various specialties. Given only when projects can be scheduled. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 498.title: Professional Internship in Theater, Film, and Television

THEATER 50.description: Laboratory, three to six hours. Laboratory experience in various aspects of theater production, including stage management or member of production crew. May be repeated for maximum of 8 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 50.title: Theater Production

THEATER 501.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Preparation: consent of UCLA graduate adviser and graduate dean, and host campus instructor, department chair, and graduate dean. Used to record enrollment of UCLA students in courses taken under cooperative arrangements with USC. S/U grading.
THEATER 501.title: Cooperative Program

THEATER 596A.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Designed for graduate students. May be repeated with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 596A.title: Directed Individual Studies: Research

THEATER 596B.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Designed for graduate students. May be repeated with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 596B.title: Directed Individual Studies: Writing

THEATER 596C.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Designed for graduate students. May be repeated with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 596C.title: Directed Individual Studies: Directing

THEATER 596D.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Designed for graduate students. May be repeated with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 596D.title: Directed Individual Studies: Design

THEATER 596E.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Designed for graduate students. May be repeated with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 596E.title: Directed Individual Studies: Acting

THEATER 596F.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Designed for graduate students. May be repeated with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER 596F.title: Directed Individual Studies: Production

THEATER 597.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Writing of prospectus and three reading lists. May be repeated for credit. S/U grading.
THEATER 597.title: Preparation for Ph.D

THEATER 599.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Preparation: advancement to Ph.D. candidacy. Research for and writing of Ph.D. dissertation. May be repeated for credit. S/U grading.
THEATER 599.title: Ph.D

THEATER 72.description: Studio, three hours. Exploration and laboratory experience in one or more of various aspects of production and postproduction practice for entertainment media, including theater, film, video, and digital media. May be taken for maximum of 8 units. Letter grading.
THEATER 72.title: Production Practice in Theater, Film, Video, and Digital Media

THEATER 89.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER 89.title: Honors Seminars

THEATER 95.description: Tutorial, six to 12 hours. Limited to freshmen/sophomores. Internship at various theaters, studios, or entertainment organizations accentuating creative contributions, organization, and work of professionals in various specialties. Students meet on regular basis with faculty member and provide periodic reports of experience. May be taken for maximum of 4 units. Individual contract with supervising faculty member required. P/NP grading.
THEATER 95.title: Introduction to Community or Corporate Internships in Theater, Film, and Television

THEATER 98T.description: Seminar, three hours. Requisite: satisfaction of Entry-Level Writing requirement. Freshmen/sophomores preferred. Overview of theatrical and site-specific performance around prison spaces. Emphasis on contemporary work, with time periods explored by artists and scholars of interest ranging from antebellum era to era of Beyoncé. Letter grading.
THEATER 98T.title: Prisons on Stage: From Antebellum Era to Era of Beyoncé

THEATER 99.description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.
THEATER 99.title: Student Research Program

THEATER C104E.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of pre-Renaissance architectural and interior decor as manifestation of cultural, social, economic, and political influences to provide historical framework for design of scenery, costumes, and lighting for theater, film, and television. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C404E. Letter grading.
THEATER C104E.title: History of Design Décor Part I: Architecture and Decor -- Antiquity to Early Neoclassical

THEATER C104F.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of post-Renaissance architectural and interior decor as manifestation of cultural, social, economic, and political influences to provide historical framework for design of scenery, costumes, and lighting for theater, film, and television. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C404F. Letter grading.
THEATER C104F.title: History of Design Décor Part II: Architecture and Decor -- Industrial Revolution to 21st Century

THEATER C104G.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of historic costume as manifestation of cultural, social, economic, and political influences to provide historical framework for design of costumes for theater, film, and television. Survey of history of Western costume and civilian attire. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C404G. Letter grading.
THEATER C104G.title: History of Design for Performance Production Part I: Historic Costume from Prehistoric to Neoclassical

THEATER C104I.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of historic costume as manifestation of cultural, social, economic, and political influences to provide historical framework for design of costumes for theater, film, and television. Survey of history of Western costume and civilian attire with global emphasis. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C404I. Letter grading.
THEATER C104I.title: History of Design for Performance Production Part II: Historic Costume from Neoclassical to 21st Century

THEATER C104J.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Historic survey and in-depth exploration of selected periods and subcategories of decor and costume. Visual representation, with emphasis on influences of global diverse cultures. May be repeated three times for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C404J. Letter grading.
THEATER C104J.title: History of Design for Performance Production: Selected Topics of Decor and Costume Design History

THEATER C122.description: (Formerly numbered 122.) Studio, four hours. Examination of importance of makeup and hair design in film. History and overview of hair and makeup in fashion and motion pictures. Collaboration of makeup artists and hairstylists with costume designer, actors, production designer, and director to conceptualize people in script. Exploration of makeup artist and hairstylist roles in current film, television, and theater productions and skills needed to design makeup and hair for film and television productions. Concurrently scheduled with course C222. Letter grading.
THEATER C122.title: Character Development through Makeup and Hair Design

THEATER C133A.description: Lecture, three hours; studio, four to 24 hours. Guided process of script development, with emphasis on communication, artistic growth, and professional process. May be taken for maximum of 8 units. Concurrently scheduled with course C433A. Letter grading.
THEATER C133A.title: Script Development Workshop

THEATER C133C.description: Lecture, three hours; studio, four to 24 hours. Guided process of script development, with emphasis on communication, artistic growth, and professional process. May be taken for maximum of 8 units. Concurrently scheduled with courses C433C. Letter grading.
THEATER C133C.title: Script Development Workshop

THEATER C137.description: Seminar, four hours. Survey of major emerging and contemporary technologies and their potential uses in and impact on live performance, from augmented and virtual reality to electronic textiles, Internet of Things, and Modern approaches to artificial intelligence. Offers solid basis for engaging in future collaborations with technologists, for self-study of new technologies, and, for those already more familiar with digital technologies, theoretical background for engaging with social context of these technologies. Concurrently scheduled with course C437. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER C137.title: Emerging Technologies and Their Uses in Live Performance

THEATER C140A.description: Studio, three hours. Study and practice in object-based programming using MAX/MSP programming language. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C440A. Letter grading.
THEATER C140A.title: Introduction to Programming for Entertainment Design

THEATER C140B.description: Studio, three hours. Study and practice in object-based programming using MAX/MSP programming language to control sound and video. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C440B. Letter grading.
THEATER C140B.title: Advanced Programming for Entertainment Design

THEATER C140C.description: Studio, three hours. Advanced projects using object-based programming to control sound and video. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C440C. Letter grading.
THEATER C140C.title: Advanced Projects in Programming for Entertainment Design

THEATER C144A.description: Lecture, four hours; laboratory, four hours. Study of sound and acoustics as they relate to performance environments, techniques associated with recording, mixing, processing, automation, and reproduction of dialogue, effects, and music tracks for theater sound design. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C444A. Letter grading.
THEATER C144A.title: Advanced Sound Design

THEATER C144B.description: Lecture, four hours; laboratory, four hours. Advanced study and practice in preparation and recording of theater sound designs, with emphasis on analysis of script and score, conceptual development of design, and multitrack recording techniques to realize design. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C444B. Letter grading.
THEATER C144B.title: Advanced Sound Design

THEATER C144C.description: Lecture, four hours; laboratory, four hours. Study and practice in processing and mixing of live and recorded sound; mix-down of multitrack recordings; preparation of sound tracks and sound reinforcement in theater. Study of creation of sound effects, control of MIDI data, and design techniques for music theater. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C444C. Letter grading.
THEATER C144C.title: Advanced Sound Design

THEATER C146A.description: Lecture, three hours. Conceptualization, design, and prototyping of interactive theatrical events. Exploration of original forms of media-rich entertainment experience through lectures, presentations, and seminar participation. Students form collaborative teams to conceive and propose interactive entertainment events. Concurrently scheduled with course C446A. Letter grading.
THEATER C146A.title: Art and Process of Entertainment Design

THEATER C146B.description: Lecture, three hours. Conceptualization, design, and prototyping of interactive theatrical events. Prototype development; two to five proposals to be more completely defined and developed. Students form collaborative teams for further conceptual development of their project proposals. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C446B. Letter grading.
THEATER C146B.title: Art and Process of Entertainment Design

THEATER C151A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, composition, and style leading to visual presentation of design. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C451A. Letter grading.
THEATER C151A.title: Scenic Design

THEATER C151B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of scenic design for proscenium, thrust, and arena configurations, multiset productions, and music theater. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C451B. Letter grading.
THEATER C151B.title: Scenic Design for Theater

THEATER C151C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of role of art director, scenic design for single-camera and multicamera production, and set decoration. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C451C. Letter grading.
THEATER C151C.title: Production Design for Film, Television, and Video

THEATER C152A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of lighting, with emphasis on imagination, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of composition and control of light and color in relation to actor. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C452A. Letter grading.
THEATER C152A.title: Lighting Design

THEATER C152B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of lighting design for proscenium, thrust, and arena configurations, music theater, and concert lighting. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C452B. Letter grading.
THEATER C152B.title: Lighting Design for Theater

THEATER C152C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of current professional lighting design practices in television for single- and multiple-camera production. Concurrently scheduled with course C452C. Letter grading.
THEATER C152C.title: Lighting Design for Television

THEATER C152D.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses C152A, C152B, C152C. Advanced topics in lighting design, including live performances for concerts, exhibitions, and live events. Concurrently scheduled with course C452D. Letter grading.
THEATER C152D.title: Lighting Design for Performances and Special Events

THEATER C152E.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisite: course C152A, C152B, or C152C. Advanced topics in lighting design, concentrating on live dance performance in all styles. Concurrently scheduled with course C452E. Letter grading.
THEATER C152E.title: Lighting Design For Dance

THEATER C153A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C; for transfer students: course 149. Imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, composition, and style leading to visual presentation of design. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C453A. Letter grading.
THEATER C153A.title: Costume Design

THEATER C153B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C; for transfer students: course 149. Study of costume design for proscenium, thrust, and arena configurations, multiset productions, and music theater. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C453B. Letter grading.
THEATER C153B.title: Costume Design for Theater

THEATER C153C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C; for transfer students: course 149. Study of current professional costume design and wardrobe practices in film and television, including effect of differing media on design choices. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C453C. Letter grading.
THEATER C153C.title: Costume Design for Film and Television

THEATER C153D.description: Lecture, three hours. Examination of professional duties of costume designers, set costumers, and supervisors, especially management of production logistics, including but not limited to costume breakdowns, creating budgets, adhering to and overseeing them, as well as set costumer training for film and television, practicing on-set protocol, breakdown of daily responsibilities, and assembling set costumer kits ready for production. Practice with professional resourcefulness to move from abstract to substantive problem solving, maintaining creative and collaborative environment while adhering to logistical obstacles and tasks. Concurrently scheduled with course C453D. Letter grading.
THEATER C153D.title: Projects in Costume Design Management

THEATER C153E.description: Lecture, three hours; screenings, two to six hours. History of costume design within context of 20th-century fashion and film history, including evolution of role of costume designer since early days of film industry. Role of costume designer and contribution of costume design to cinematic storytelling. Concurrently scheduled with course C453E. Letter grading.
THEATER C153E.title: History of Costume Design in Movies (Effective Spring 2018 )

THEATER C153F.description: Lecture, three hours. Introduction to costume design as tool for storytelling, exploring integration of costume design and filmmaking process and what it takes to bring characters to life. Skills needed to effectively costume short narrative films, including script breakdown, collaboration with directors and actors, and how to manage production challenges. Concurrently scheduled with course C453F. Letter grading.
THEATER C153F.title: Practice of Costume Design for Film Productions

THEATER C154A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Introduction to sound and audio in acoustic, audio, and digital domain. Study and practice of techniques for recording, editing, and creating soundscapes. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C454A. Letter grading.
THEATER C154A.title: Sound Design

THEATER C154B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Exploration of sound design for theater and techniques for mixing, reinforcement, and signal processing. Topics include use of delay, equalization, and microphone placement for theater sound reinforcement. Study of creation of sound effects, control of MIDI data, and design techniques for musical theater. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C454B. Letter grading.
THEATER C154B.title: Sound Design for Theater

THEATER C154C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of current professional sound recording, rerecording, mixing, and synchronization practices for film and television. Concurrently scheduled with course C454C. Letter grading.
THEATER C154C.title: Sound for Film and Television

THEATER C155A.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Introduction to use of pencil and pen to communicate scenic designs, including one- and two-paint perspective, form light, shade, and textures. Concurrently scheduled with course C455A. Letter grading.
THEATER C155A.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Perspective Drawing

THEATER C155B.description: Studio, four hours. Study and practice of multimedia rendering techniques as they relate to interpretation of scenic, lighting, and costume renderings, with focus on human form in space. Weekly demonstrations of wide variety of art media, including watercolor, markers, pastel, and collage rendering. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C455B. Letter grading.
THEATER C155B.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Multimedia Rendering

THEATER C155C.description: Studio, four hours. Study and practice in rendering costumes, lighting, and scenic elements with combination of hand and digital rendering techniques. Coverage of rendering from life, enhancing final rendering with variety of computer-assisted formats to create polished sophisticated presentations for theater, film, and television productions. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C455C. Letter grading.
THEATER C155C.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Digital Rendering

THEATER C155D.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Study of model for representation of scenic designs from initial working prototypes to finished color models. Use of wide variety of materials and techniques for execution of model. Concurrently scheduled with course C455D. Letter grading.
THEATER C155D.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Model Making

THEATER C155E.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Study and practice in drawing of human form. Concurrently scheduled with course C455E. Letter grading.
THEATER C155E.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Life Drawing

THEATER C155F.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Study of techniques for rendering theatrical costumes, with emphasis on figure, clothing, and fabrics. Concurrently scheduled with course C455F. Letter grading.
THEATER C155F.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Costume Rendering

THEATER C155G.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Study of scenic painting techniques and materials and their realization of color design and elevations. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C455G. Letter grading.
THEATER C155G.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Scene Painting Techniques

THEATER C155H.description: Studio, six hours. Group study of selected subjects in techniques for interpretation of design for theater. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C455H. Letter grading.
THEATER C155H.title: Selected Topics in Graphic Representation of Design

THEATER C156A.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A. Investigation of drawing and editing techniques, drawing floor plan sections, and elevation drawings using AutoCAD. Concurrently scheduled with course C456A. Letter grading.
THEATER C156A.title: Introduction to Computer-Assisted Drafting

THEATER C156B.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A. Investigation of drafting techniques for scenic and lighting designs using AutoCAD. Concurrently scheduled with course C456B. Letter grading.
THEATER C156B.title: Advanced Computer-Assisted Drafting

THEATER C156C.description: Studio, four hours. Investigation of three-dimensional lighting and scenic design previsualization: wire-frame perspective drawing and photo-realistic computer rendering techniques using three-dimensional studio. Concurrently scheduled with course C456C. Letter grading.
THEATER C156C.title: Computer-Assisted Rendering

THEATER C156D.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A. Investigation of drawing and editing techniques, drawing floor plan sections, and elevation drawings using Vectorworks. Concurrently scheduled with course C456D. Letter grading.
THEATER C156D.title: Introduction to Computer-Assisted Drafting

THEATER C156E.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A. Investigation of drafting techniques for scenic and lighting designs using Vectorworks. Concurrently scheduled with course C456E. Letter grading.
THEATER C156E.title: Advanced Computer-Assisted Drafting

THEATER C156F.description: Studio, four hours. Investigation of three-dimensional lighting and scenic design previsualization: wire-frame perspective drawing and photo-realistic computer rendering techniques using Vectorworks. Concurrently scheduled with course C456F. Letter grading.
THEATER C156F.title: Introduction to Computer-Assisted Rendering

THEATER C157A.description: Studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of theory and application of drafting, pattern making, fitting, and construction techniques for period costumes and undergarments to achieve authentic-appearing costume using contemporary methods. Introduction to draping, pattern grading fitting, and slash and spread adaptation. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C457A. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER C157A.title: Costume Construction Techniques

THEATER C157B.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course C157A. Study of theory and application of drafting, pattern making, fitting, and construction techniques for period costumes and undergarments to achieve authentic-appearing costume using contemporary methods. Introduction to costume drafting, construction of period undergarments. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C457B. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER C157B.title: Costume Construction Techniques

THEATER C157C.description: Studio, four hours. Requisites: courses C157A, C157B. Study of theory and application of drafting, pattern making, fitting, and construction techniques for period costumes and undergarments to achieve authentic-appearing costume using contemporary methods. Draping, patterning, and fitting techniques for period garments. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C457C. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER C157C.title: Costume Construction Techniques

THEATER C158A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Investigation of materials, systems, and techniques for realization of scenic designs for theater, film, and television. Study of advanced techniques and materials for construction, finishing, and rigging of scenery and properties. Concurrently scheduled with course C458A. Letter grading.
THEATER C158A.title: Scenic Design Technology

THEATER C158B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Investigation of materials, systems, and techniques for realization of lighting designs for theater, film, and television. Study of design, operation, and performance of lighting instruments, dimming equipment, and control systems, including automated fixtures, projection equipment, and computer systems for lighting. Concurrently scheduled with course C458B. Letter grading.
THEATER C158B.title: Lighting Design Technology

THEATER C158C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Investigation of materials, systems, and techniques for realization of sound designs for theater, film, and television. Study of operation and performance of equipment for recording, mixing, and reproduction of theater sound. Concurrently scheduled with course C458C. Letter grading.
THEATER C158C.title: Sound Design Technology

THEATER C163D.description: Discussion, three hours; laboratory, four to eight hours. Requisites: courses 163A, 163B, 163C. Application of stage directing techniques in production of short play or project. Students direct one-act play or project. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C263D. Letter grading.
THEATER C163D.title: Directing Project for Stage

THEATER C185A.description: Lecture, three hours. Study of structure governing economic and artistic decision-making processes in professional theater of America. Concurrently scheduled with course C285A. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER C185A.title: Role of Producer in Professional Theater

THEATER C185B.description: Lecture, three hours. Study of artistic, social, and economic criteria in administration of educational and community theater. Concurrently scheduled with course C285B. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER C185B.title: Role of Management in Educational and Community Theater

THEATER C222.description: Studio, four hours. Examination of importance of makeup and hair design in film. History and overview of hair and makeup in fashion and motion pictures. Collaboration of makeup artists and hairstylists with costume designer, actors, production designer, and director to conceptualize people in script. Exploration of makeup artist and hairstylist roles in current film, television, and theater productions and skills needed to design makeup and hair for film and television productions. Concurrently scheduled with course C122. Letter grading.
THEATER C222.title: Character Development through Makeup and Hair Design

THEATER C263D.description: Discussion, three hours; laboratory, four to eight hours. Requisites: courses 163A, 163B, 163C. Application of stage directing techniques in production of short play or project. Students direct one-act play or project. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C163D. Letter grading.
THEATER C263D.title: Directing Project for Stage

THEATER C285A.description: Lecture, three hours. Designed for graduate students. Study of structure governing economic and artistic decision-making processes in professional theater of America. Concurrently scheduled with course C185A. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER C285A.title: Role of Producer in Professional Theater

THEATER C285B.description: Lecture, three hours. Designed for graduate students. Study of artistic, social, and economic criteria in administration of educational and community theater. Concurrently scheduled with course C185B. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER C285B.title: Role of Management in Educational and Community Theater

THEATER C404E.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of pre-Renaissance architectural and interior decor as manifestation of cultural, social, economic, and political influences to provide historical framework for design of scenery, costumes, and lighting for theater, film, and television. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C104E. Letter grading.
THEATER C404E.title: History of Design Décor Part I: Architecture and Decor -- Antiquity to Early Neoclassical

THEATER C404F.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of post-Renaissance architectural and interior decor as manifestation of cultural, social, economic, and political influences to provide historical framework for design of scenery, costumes, and lighting for theater, film, and television. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C104F. Letter grading.
THEATER C404F.title: History of Design Décor Part II: Architecture and Decor -- Industrial Revolution to 21st Century

THEATER C404G.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of historic costume as manifestation of cultural, social, economic, and political influences to provide historical framework for design of costumes for theater, film, and television. Survey of history of Western costume and civilian attire. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C104G. Letter grading.
THEATER C404G.title: History of Design for Performance Production Part I: Historic Costume from Prehistoric to Neoclassical

THEATER C404I.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of historic costume as manifestation of cultural, social, economic, and political influences to provide historical framework for design of costumes for theater, film, and television. Survey of history of Western costume and civilian attire with global emphasis. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C104I. Letter grading.
THEATER C404I.title: History of Design for Performance Production Part II: Historic Costume from Neoclassical to 21st Century

THEATER C404J.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Historic survey and in-depth exploration of selected periods and subcategories of decor and costume. Visual representation, with emphasis on influences of global diverse cultures. May be repeated three times for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C104J. Letter grading.
THEATER C404J.title: History of Design for Performance Production: Selected Topics of Decor and Costume Design History

THEATER C433A.description: Lecture, three hours; studio, four to 24 hours. Designed for graduate students. Guided process of script development, with emphasis on communication, artistic growth, and professional process. May be taken for maximum of 8 units. Concurrently scheduled with course C133A. Letter grading.
THEATER C433A.title: Script Development Workshop

THEATER C433C.description: Lecture, three hours; studio, four to 24 hours. Designed for graduate students. Guided process of script development, with emphasis on communication, artistic growth, and professional process. May be taken for maximum of 8 units. Concurrently scheduled with course C133C. Letter grading.
THEATER C433C.title: Script Development Workshop

THEATER C437.description: Seminar, four hours. Survey of major emerging and contemporary technologies and their potential uses in and impact on live performance, from augmented and virtual reality to electronic textiles, Internet of Things, and Modern approaches to artificial intelligence. Offers solid basis for engaging in future collaborations with technologists, for self-study of new technologies, and, for those already more familiar with digital technologies, theoretical background for engaging with social context of these technologies. Concurrently scheduled with course C137. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER C437.title: Emerging Technologies and Their Uses in Live Performance

THEATER C440A.description: Studio, three hours. Study and practice in object-based programming using MAX/MSP programming language. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C140A. Letter grading.
THEATER C440A.title: Introduction to Programming for Entertainment Design

THEATER C440B.description: Studio, three hours. Study and practice in object-based programming using MAX/MSP programming language to control sound and video. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C140B. Letter grading.
THEATER C440B.title: Advanced Programming for Entertainment Design

THEATER C440C.description: Studio, three hours. Advanced projects using object-based programming to control sound and video. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C140C. Letter grading.
THEATER C440C.title: Advanced Projects in Programming for Entertainment Design

THEATER C444A.description: Lecture, four hours; laboratory, four hours. Study of sound and acoustics as they relate to performance environments, techniques associated with recording, mixing, processing, automation, and reproduction of dialogue, effects, and music tracks for theater sound design. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C144A. Letter grading.
THEATER C444A.title: Advanced Sound Design

THEATER C444B.description: Lecture, four hours; laboratory, four hours. Advanced study and practice in preparation and recording of theater sound designs, with emphasis on analysis of script and score, conceptual development of design, and multitrack recording techniques to realize design. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C144B. Letter grading.
THEATER C444B.title: Advanced Sound Design

THEATER C444C.description: Lecture, four hours; laboratory, four hours. Study and practice in processing and mixing of live and recorded sound; mix-down of multitrack recordings; preparation of sound tracks and sound reinforcement in theater. Study of creation of sound effects, control of MIDI data, and design techniques for music theater. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C144C. Letter grading.
THEATER C444C.title: Advanced Sound Design

THEATER C446A.description: Lecture, three hours. Conceptualization, design, and prototyping of interactive theatrical events. Exploration of original forms of media-rich entertainment experience through lectures, presentations, and seminar participation. Students form collaborative teams to conceive and propose interactive entertainment events. Concurrently scheduled with course C146A. Letter grading.
THEATER C446A.title: Art and Process of Entertainment Design

THEATER C446B.description: Lecture, three hours. Conceptualization, design, and prototyping of interactive theatrical events. Prototype development; two to five proposals to be more completely defined and developed. Students form collaborative teams for further conceptual development of their project proposals. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C146B. Letter grading.
THEATER C446B.title: Art and Process of Entertainment Design

THEATER C451A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, composition, and style leading to visual presentation of design. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C151A. Letter grading.
THEATER C451A.title: Scenic Design

THEATER C451B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of scenic design for proscenium, thrust, and arena configurations, multiset productions, and music theater. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C151B. Letter grading.
THEATER C451B.title: Scenic Design for Theater

THEATER C451C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of role of art director, scenic design for single-camera and multicamera production, and set decoration. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C151C. Letter grading.
THEATER C451C.title: Production Design for Film, Television, and Video

THEATER C452A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of lighting, with emphasis on imagination, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of composition and control of light and color in relation to actor. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C152A. Letter grading.
THEATER C452A.title: Lighting Design

THEATER C452B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of lighting design for proscenium, thrust, and arena configurations, music theater, and concert lighting. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C152B. Letter grading.
THEATER C452B.title: Lighting Design for Theater

THEATER C452C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of current professional lighting design practices in television for single- and multiple-camera production. Concurrently scheduled with course C152C. Letter grading.
THEATER C452C.title: Lighting Design for Television

THEATER C452D.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisites: courses C452A, C452B, C452C. Advanced topics in lighting design, including live performances for concerts, exhibitions, and live events. Concurrently scheduled with course C152D. Letter grading.
THEATER C452D.title: Lighting Design for Performances and Special Events

THEATER C452E.description: Lecture, four hours. Requisite: course C441A, C441B, or C441C. Advanced topics in lighting design, concentrating on live dance performance in all styles. Concurrently scheduled with course C152E. Letter grading.
THEATER C452E.title: Lighting Design For Dance

THEATER C453A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Imagination as impetus for design, text analysis, metaphor, and conceptualization. Investigation of design research process, composition, and style leading to visual presentation of design. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C153A. Letter grading.
THEATER C453A.title: Costume Design

THEATER C453B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of costume design for proscenium, thrust, and arena configurations, multiset productions, and music theater. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C153B. Letter grading.
THEATER C453B.title: Costume Design for Theater

THEATER C453C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of current professional costume design and wardrobe practices in film and television, including effect of differing media on design choices. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C153C. Letter grading.
THEATER C453C.title: Costume Design for Film and Television

THEATER C453D.description: Lecture, three hours. Examination of professional duties of costume designers, set costumers, and supervisors, especially management of production logistics, including but not limited to costume breakdowns, creating budgets, adhering to and overseeing them, as well as set costumer training for film and television, practicing on-set protocol, breakdown of daily responsibilities, and assembling set costumer kits ready for production. Practice with professional resourcefulness to move from abstract to substantive problem solving, maintaining creative and collaborative environment while adhering to logistical obstacles and tasks. Concurrently scheduled with course C153D. Letter grading.
THEATER C453D.title: Projects in Costume Design Management

THEATER C453E.description: Lecture, three hours; screenings, two to six hours. History of costume design within context of 20th-century fashion and film history, including evolution of role of costume designer since early days of film industry. Role of costume designer and contribution of costume design to cinematic storytelling. Concurrently scheduled with course C153E. Letter grading.
THEATER C453E.title: History of Costume Design in Movies (Effective Spring 2018 )

THEATER C453F.description: Lecture, three hours. Introduction to costume design as tool for storytelling, exploring integration of costume design and filmmaking process and what it takes to bring characters to life. Skills needed to effectively costume short narrative films, including script breakdown, collaboration with directors and actors, and how to manage production challenges. Concurrently scheduled with course C153F. Letter grading.
THEATER C453F.title: Practice of Costume Design for Film Productions

THEATER C454A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Introduction to sound and audio in acoustic, audio, and digital domain. Study and practice of techniques for recording, editing, and creating soundscapes. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C154A. Letter grading.
THEATER C454A.title: Sound Design

THEATER C454B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Exploration of sound design for theater and techniques for mixing, reinforcement, and signal processing. Topics include use of delay, equalization, and microphone placement for theater sound reinforcement. Study of creation of sound effects, control of MIDI data, and design techniques for musical theater. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C154B. Letter grading.
THEATER C454B.title: Sound Design for Theater

THEATER C454C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Study of current professional sound recording, rerecording, mixing, and synchronization practices for film and television. Concurrently scheduled with course C154C. Graduate students expected to produce designs demonstrating higher level of proficiency and skill. Letter grading.
THEATER C454C.title: Sound for Film and Television

THEATER C455A.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Introduction to use of pencil and pen to communicate scenic designs, including one- and two-paint perspective, form light, shade, and textures. Graduate students expected to produce drawings demonstrating higher level of proficiency and skill. Concurrently scheduled with course C155A. Letter grading.
THEATER C455A.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Perspective Drawing

THEATER C455B.description: Studio, four hours. Study and practice of multimedia rendering techniques as they relate to interpretation of scenic, lighting, and costume renderings, with focus on human form in space. Weekly demonstrations of wide variety of art media, including watercolor, markers, pastel, and collage rendering. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C155B. Letter grading.
THEATER C455B.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Multimedia Rendering

THEATER C455C.description: Studio, four hours. Study and practice in rendering costumes, lighting, and scenic elements with combination of hand and digital rendering techniques. Coverage of rendering from life, enhancing final rendering with variety of computer-assisted formats to create polished sophisticated presentations for theater, film, and television productions. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C155C. Letter grading.
THEATER C455C.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Digital Rendering

THEATER C455D.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Study of model for representation of scenic designs from initial working prototypes to finished color models. Use of wide variety of materials and techniques for execution of model. Graduate students expected to produce models demonstrating higher level of proficiency and skill. Concurrently scheduled with course C155D. Letter grading.
THEATER C455D.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Model Making

THEATER C455E.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Study and practice in drawing of human form. Concurrently scheduled with course C155E. Letter grading.
THEATER C455E.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Life Drawing

THEATER C455F.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Study of techniques for rendering theatrical costumes, with emphasis on figure, clothing, and fabrics. Concurrently scheduled with course C155F. Letter grading.
THEATER C455F.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Costume Rendering

THEATER C455G.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A or 147B. Study of scenic painting techniques and materials and their realization of color design and elevations. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C155G. Letter grading.
THEATER C455G.title: Graphic Representation of Design: Scene Painting Techniques

THEATER C455H.description: Studio, six hours. Group study of selected subjects in techniques for interpretation of design for theater. May be repeated once for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER C455H.title: Selected Topics in Graphic Representation of Design

THEATER C456A.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A. Investigation of drawing and editing techniques, drawing floor plan sections, and elevation drawings using AutoCAD. Concurrently scheduled with course C156A. Letter grading.
THEATER C456A.title: Introduction to Computer-Assisted Drafting

THEATER C456B.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A. Investigation of drafting techniques for scenic and lighting designs using AutoCAD. Concurrently scheduled with course C156B. Letter grading.
THEATER C456B.title: Advanced Computer-Assisted Drafting

THEATER C456C.description: Studio, four hours. Investigation of three-dimensional lighting and scenic design previsualization: wire-frame perspective drawing and photo-realistic computer rendering techniques using three-dimensional studio. Concurrently scheduled with course C156C. Letter grading.
THEATER C456C.title: Computer-Assisted Rendering

THEATER C456D.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A. Investigation of drawing and editing techniques, drawing floor plan sections, and elevation drawings using Vectorworks. Concurrently scheduled with course C156D. Letter grading.
THEATER C456D.title: Introduction to Computer-Assisted Drafting

THEATER C456E.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course 147A. Investigation of drafting techniques for scenic and lighting designs using Vectorworks. Concurrently scheduled with course C156E. Letter grading.
THEATER C456E.title: Advanced Computer-Assisted Drafting

THEATER C456F.description: Studio, four hours. Investigation of three-dimensional lighting and scenic design previsualization: wire-frame perspective drawing and photo-realistic computer rendering techniques using Vectorworks. Concurrently scheduled with course C156F. Letter grading.
THEATER C456F.title: Introduction to Computer-Assisted Rendering

THEATER C457A.description: Studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Study of theory and application of drafting, pattern making, fitting, and construction techniques for period costumes and undergarments to achieve authentic-appearing costume using contemporary methods. Introduction to draping, pattern grading fitting, and slash and spread adaptation. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C157A. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER C457A.title: Costume Construction Techniques

THEATER C457B.description: Studio, four hours. Requisite: course C457A. Study of theory and application of drafting, pattern making, fitting, and construction techniques for period costumes and undergarments to achieve authentic-appearing costume using contemporary methods. Introduction to costume drafting, construction of period undergarments. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C157B. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER C457B.title: Costume Construction Techniques

THEATER C457C.description: Studio, four hours. Requisites: courses C457A, C457B. Study of theory and application of drafting, pattern making, fitting, and construction techniques for period costumes and undergarments to achieve authentic-appearing costume using contemporary methods. Draping, patterning, and fitting techniques for period garments. May be repeated once for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course C157C. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER C457C.title: Costume Construction Techniques

THEATER C458A.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Investigation of materials, systems, and techniques for realization of scenic designs for theater, film, and television. Study of advanced techniques and materials for construction, finishing, and rigging of scenery and properties. Concurrently scheduled with course C158A. Letter grading.
THEATER C458A.title: Scenic Design Technology

THEATER C458B.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Investigation of materials, systems, and techniques for realization of lighting designs for theater, film, and television. Study of design, operation, and performance of lighting instruments, dimming equipment, and control systems, including automated fixtures, projection equipment, and computer systems for lighting. Concurrently scheduled with course C158B. Letter grading.
THEATER C458B.title: Lighting Design Technology

THEATER C458C.description: Lecture/studio, four hours. Requisites: courses 14A, 14B, 14C. Investigation of materials, systems, and techniques for realization of sound designs for theater, film, and television. Study of operation and performance of equipment for recording, mixing, and reproduction of theater sound. Concurrently scheduled with course C158C. Letter grading.
THEATER C458C.title: Sound Design Technology

THEATER CM129.description: (Same as Film and Television CM129.) Lecture, two hours; screenings, two hours. Limited to junior/senior and graduate theater/film and television students. Examination of creative process in theater, film, and television, with consideration of writing, direction, production, and performance. Overview of individual contributions in collaborative effort; examination of distinctiveness and interrelations among these arts. Individual units include participation of leading members of theater, film, and television professions. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course CM229. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER CM129.title: Contemporary Topics in Theater, Film, and Television

THEATER CM229.description: (Same as Film and Television CM229.) Lecture, two hours; screenings, two hours. Limited to junior/senior and graduate theater/film and television students. Examination of creative process in theater, film, and television, with consideration of writing, direction, production, and performance. Overview of individual contributions in collaborative effort; examination of distinctiveness and interrelations among these arts. Individual units include participation of leading members of theater, film, and television professions. May be repeated twice for credit. Concurrently scheduled with course CM129. S/U or letter grading.
THEATER CM229.title: Contemporary Topics in Theater, Film, and Television

THEATER M103A.description: (Same as African American Studies M103A.) Lecture, three hours. Designed for juniors/seniors. Exploration of extant materials on history and literature of theater as developed and performed by African American artists in America from slavery to mid-1800s. Letter grading.
THEATER M103A.title: African American Theater History: Slavery to Mid-1800s

THEATER M103B.description: (Same as African American Studies M103B.) Lecture, three hours. Designed for juniors/seniors. Exploration of extant materials on history and literature of theater as developed and performed by African American artists in America from minstrel stage to rise of American musical. Letter grading.
THEATER M103B.title: African American Theater History: Minstrel Stage to Rise of American Musical

THEATER M103C.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M103C.) Lecture, three hours. Designed for juniors/seniors. Exploration of development of Chicano theater from its beginning in legends and rituals of ancient Mexico to work of Luis Valdez (late 1960s). P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER M103C.title: Origins and Evolution of Chicano Theater

THEATER M103D.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M103D.) Lecture, three hours. Analysis and discussion of historical and political events from 1965 to 1980, as well as theatrical traditions that led to emergence of Chicano theater. Letter grading.
THEATER M103D.title: Contemporary Chicano Theater: Beginning of Chicano Theater Movement

THEATER M103E.description: (Same as African American Studies M103E.) Lecture, three hours. Survey and examination of African American plays from 1920s until birth of modern civil rights era. Examination of sociohistorical context out of which plays were created and critical essays that illustrate development of African American playwrights and their significant involvement in creation of diversified American theatrical tradition. Letter grading.
THEATER M103E.title: Modern African American Drama: Harlem Renaissance to Black Arts Movement

THEATER M103G.description: (Same as Chicana and Chicano Studies M103G.) Lecture, three hours. Analysis and discussion of Chicano theater since 1980, including discussion of Chicana playwrights, magic realism, Chicano comedy, and Chicano performance art. Letter grading.
THEATER M103G.title: Contemporary Chicano Theater: Chicano Theater since 1980

THEATER M103J.description: (Same as African American Studies M103J.) Lecture, three hours. Examination of black theater from Black Arts Movement of 1960s until today. Exploration of social and historical implications of work, and aesthetic experimentation of contemporary African American playwrights and movements. Letter grading.
THEATER M103J.title: Contemporary Black Theater: Modern Civil Rights Era to Black Lives Matter and Beyond

THEATER M109.description: (Same as Honors Collegium M120.) Lecture, four hours; discussion, one hour. Drawing from objects in five major collections at Getty Museum, focus on five parallel historical periods in which political, social, and aesthetic philosophy of age is examined in musical and dramatic performance. Letter grading.
THEATER M109.title: Art and Performance: Interdisciplinary Approach to Collections of Getty Center

THEATER M114.description: (Same as Disability Studies M114.) Seminar, four hours. Analysis and critique of depiction of disability in theater. Topics may include introduction to disability studies; race, gender, and disability; representation of disability in theater; and more. May be repeated for credit with topic or instructor change. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER M114.title: Variable Topics in Performance and Disability Studies

THEATER M178.description: (Same as Film and Television M177.) Laboratory, four hours. Workshop providing opportunities for students to rehearse, perform, and evaluate scenes. Three different production styles to which performers may need to adjust are (1) preproduction rehearsals with director, (2) single-camera experience, and (3) multiple-camera experience. May be repeated twice for credit. Letter grading.
THEATER M178.title: Film and Television Acting Workshop

THEATER M187.description: (Formerly numbered M193.) (Same as Honors Collegium M116.) Seminar, four hours. Offered in collaboration with Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA). Interpretation of art in collection through acting, dialogues, movement, and music. Research into history and art history and production of creative performance piece required. P/NP or letter grading.
THEATER M187.title: Art Alive: Art and Improvisation in Museums
